title: Integrate the factory-ts package
description:
A local package was created that is currently placed in `packages/factory-ts` relative to this project.
This package allows calling agents to run on specific projects, tasks and features. It needs to be integrated into this project so agents can be ran on specific tasks or features and agent performance can be monitored. If at any point changes are required in the factory-ts - those can be applied directly.

features.title: Add the local 'factory-ts' package into this project
features.description:
The package is located at `packages/factory-ts`
The factor-ts documentation is
`packages/factory-ts/FACTORY_TS_OVERVIEW.md` whereas the configuration documantion is: `packages/factory-ts/CONFIGURATION.md`

features.title: Missing console logs
features.description: If the factory-ts is run in development mode - there should be console logs for all crucial operations to be able to trace what is happening with the agents.

features.title: TaskDetailsView improvements after running an agent
features.description:
The AgentRunBullet should use the same chip styles as a DependencyBullet.
Both features and tasks can only ever have 1 agent running on them.

features.title: Running an agent doesn't work
features.description:
The agent should be run with the active LLMConfig (the same that is used for chats).
All messages sent to and from agent should be visible in the console logs.

features.title: factory-ts is the source of truth when it comes to Project,Task,Feature types
features.description: Integrate them inside this project meaning that 'src/types/tasks.ts' is no longer needed. All places where they were used must be updated.

features.title: Allow agents to run on tasks and features using the factory-ts package
features.description: Inside TasksListView.tsx and TaskDetailsView.tsx it must be possible to launch agents and to see agents that are already working.

features.title: Add an 'Agents' tab (in Sidebar) to monitor agents working
features.description: All agents that are running on a given project can be monitored from this tab, showing their performance and costs.

features.title: Add an 'All Agents' tab under 'Settings' (in Sidebar) where summaries of all agents can be seen
features.description: All runs of agents can be seen and analysed. Seeing the costs and performance. And seeing which models perform well.
features.rejection: The 'All Agents' is a separate screen from Settings - it is positioned just below it in the Sidebar.
